column4: Is there another hard drive app besides Disk Usage Analyzer that would be a good one to use ? ?
what sort of tool you want
Running 10.4
Something that would be a nice GUI that would give me a more detailed output.
what sort of information?  like  usage analysis ?
Yup
SMART data? disk properties?...etc
Any of those would be ok.
Disk properties, how much soace is left, what files are taking more room, etc. etc.
gnome disk usage analysis is pretty decent already.  and for disk properties you could try palimpsest
Opps I meant "space"
doesn't gnome disk usage analysis do the task?
How about something that would give you report of the health or a type of disk chk?
that's about SMART data.  palimpsest does that
gsmartcontrol also
Cool - Thanks much Will take a look see....
oops palimpsest doesn't do smart :P
ok
and for disk partitioning/file system, you could use gparted
Yea actually had forgotten how great that app is - looked at it 8/9 months ago and had forgotten about it.
Just did a "hard drive" search in "Ubuntu Software Center" and found "GSmartControl" that looks promising.
Also "Graphical Disk Map" Thanks for input.
